CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. PSC (Polymer Solar Cell)
2. PC71BM (Perylene-based donor material)
3. PTATDPP (a hypothetical donor material)

So, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PSC
2. PC71BM
3. PTATDPP
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! My apologies for including irrelevant entities earlier. Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PSC
2. PC71BM

So, the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph are:

1. PSC
2. PC71BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSC |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. PCE - Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency
2. PC71BM - Polycrystalline silicon (a common electron acceptor material)
3. VOC - Open-circuit voltage
4. JSC - Short-circuit current density
5. FF - Fill factor

These are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph, which are proper nouns or common nouns that refer to specific properties or characteristics of the materials being discussed.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the "Material Property" entities in the paragraph:

1. PCE - Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency
2. FF - Fill factor

These are the entities that clearly refer to material properties of the solar cells.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) |
| FF (Fill factor) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph!

In this paragraph, there are two "Property Value" entities:

1. "PCE" (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency): This is the value of the efficiency of the solar cell in converting sunlight into electrical energy.
2. "V OC" (Open Circuit Voltage): This is the voltage reached by the solar cell when it is in the open circuit state, with no load connected.
3. "J SC" (Short Circuit Current): This is the current flowing through the solar cell when it is in the short circuit state, with no resistance to the current.
4. "FF" (Fill Factor): This is a measure of the efficiency of the solar cell, taking into account both the V OC and J SC values. It represents the ratio of the actual power output of the cell to the maximum possible power output, had the cell been able to operate at its V OC and J SC values simultaneously.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant "Property Value" entities in the paragraph:

1. "PCE" (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency): This is the value of the efficiency of the solar cell in converting sunlight into electrical energy.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid "Property Value" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table:

| --- |
| PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) |
